item.title: Version 1.2.20 (Build 20260204.1)
item.description:
What's New

Fix VNI/Telex Shift+number key handling for symbols like @, #, $

Problem:

  • VNI mode: Typing 'o' + Shift+2 resulted in 'ò' instead of 'o@'
  • After fixing VNI, backspace couldn't restore word for continued editing
  • Telex mode: Same issue with non-Vietnamese characters

Root causes:

  1. isUppercase was incorrectly calculated for Shift+number keys

(based on character case, '@' has no uppercase → false)

  1. engine.reset() was called which clears history
  2. cursorMovedSinceReset flag wasn't reset after word break

Fixes:

  1. XKeyIMController: Set isUppercase=true for Shift+number keys

so VNEngine treats them as word breaks

  1. XKeyIMController: Use processWordBreak() for non-Vietnamese

characters to properly save word to history

  1. XKeyIMController: Commit marked text before inserting symbols
  2. VNEngine: Reset cursorMovedSinceReset after handleWordBreak()

to allow backspace restore

Test scenarios:

  • VNI: 'o' + Shift+2 → 'o@' → backspace → 'o' → '2' → 'ò'
  • Telex: 'o' + Shift+2 → 'o@' → backspace → 'o' → 'f' → 'ò'
